level.text: Within fifteen (15) calendar days of the assignment of the case to a hearing examiner, the hearing examiner shall schedule a status conference designed to accomplish the following objectives:
To determine who is representing the parties in the case;
To establish deadlines for conducting discovery in the case;
To schedule a pre-hearing conference and a hearing in the case; and
To schedule further status conferences as may be required.
The hearing examiner shall give the parties written notice of the status conference. The notice shall include the following:
Notice of the sanctions applicable in the event of a party’s failure to appear or comply with the instructions of the notice; and
Instructions to the parties regarding the conditions and procedure for requesting continuances.
